intro: Sphaeralcea janeae, commonly known as the San Diego fairy duster, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Southern California. It is characterized by its unique, spiny, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
